laboratory_examinations.findings: At age 14 years, FSH 124 UI/l; at age 19 years, FSH 73 U/l; at age 39 years, FSH 36.3 UI/l.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: High FSH levels noted at all ages, decreasing from 124 UI/l at 14 years to 73 U/l at 19 years, but still indicative of POI.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At age 14 years, LH 34 UI/l; at age 19 years, LH 34 U/l; at age 39 years, LH 23 UI/l.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: LH levels remain elevated across different ages, consistent with primary ovarian insufficiency.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At age 14 years, Estradiol <5 pg/ml; at age 19 years, Estradiol <9.5 pg/ml; at age 39 years, Estradiol <0.03 ng/l.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Estradiol levels consistently low at all ages.
Low AMH levels confirmed at the age of 19 years; no previous measurements reported.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Anti-TPO antibodies slightly elevated at 37 UI/l (normal <34 UI/l).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No changes over time described; consistent elevation noted at 14 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient’s cells show two times more breaks at 10-6 M MMC compared to the mother; significantly more aberrant metaphases.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The mother's cells exhibited intermediate but significantly higher chromosomal breaks compared to the control.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No abnormalities in FSH, LH, TSH, T4 plasma assays; ovarian antibodies negative.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Prior tests at ages 14 and 19 years indicated POI; no significant change over the years regarding hormonal levels.

laboratory_examinations.findings: TSH and T4 levels normal across various ages.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistently normal TSH and T4 levels throughout the years.
